alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Dixon (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 05 at 8:49PM CDT until October 07 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 1 PM CDT FRIDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 30 possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Nebraska and central, east central, south central and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 4 AM to 1 PM CDT Friday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Friday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
